result.execSummary:
The defendant William D Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Pay restitution in the amount of $200.00 to Amber M. by 05/01/16. Failure to pay restitution results in a commitment to the HOC for 5 days, and a civil judgment.

*Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharges by 05/01/16, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
*Provide DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.   5 days HOC.  Due & owing.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 27  DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 27 DAYS time served, this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges by 5/1/16, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Provide DNA Sample. Court further ordered defendant to pay Restitution in the amount of $200.00 to Amber M. by 5/1/16. Failure to pay restitution results in a commitment to the House of Correction for 5 DAYS, and a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant William D Clark in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant William D Clark in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant William D Clark in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant William D Clark in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $250.00 SIGNATURE BOND. 
Defense requests a pretrial conference date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant William D Clark not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense requests a pretrial conference date. Court orders that defendant be produced for the next court date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMBER M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William D Clark in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant William D Clark in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
